name: Cindy O'brien
text:
I would not recommend her at all.  I received a shoulder injury this summer and was referred by Grandview ER to Dr. Moul.  I went to her office on a Monday and saw Dr. Sudduth who was so kind but felt that I needed to come back the next day and see Dr. Moul to talk about surgery.  I went back the next day and she looked at my X-rays, came in the examination room, and never examined  me.  She told me to take the sling off and go to physical therapy for three weeks which I did.  The therapists questioned why an MRI was never done and felt my injury was more severe than she thought and so did I.  When I returned 3 weeks later for my follow up she told me to stop therapy and gave me a steroid pack.  I told her how bad it was still hurting.  Still no MRI so I went to my regular doctor who sent me for an MRI.  I have a torn labrum and have an appointment with Dr. Andrews surgical group tomorrow.

I had my surgery with Andrews  on 11/20/20 and had a labrum tear repair,  rotator cuff repair, and debris cleanup in my joint.  I am looking at a long recovery now which could have been avoided and already done with a simple MRI four months ago to see what was really going on inside my shoulder.  I am very frustrated because I spent  probably $700-800 dollars in unnecessary PT fees and copays which only made my issues worse.  Since surgery I have started PT but am fixing to experience a break in services because I have used my allotted physical therapy services for the year by being sent needlessly to therapy for a month by Dr. Moul instead of her taking the time to do an MRI to see what would have been obvious.  I am beyond frustrated with the situation above and will be looking into possible courses of action to recover expenses that could have been avoided if she had used reasonable medical judgement.

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 205-971-3348 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: candy j
text: Dr. Bonatz has to be one of the worst doctors I’ve ever seen. My first visit with him was Nov 6 fracture ring finger sprained middle finger. He had me to start Occupational Therapy immediately. My return visit with Dec 8. My range of motion had improved however the strengthening had not even begun. All of my OT were saying the same thing my hand needed further OT because of my job. On Dec 8 2020 Dr. Bonazt entered the room and began talking with the door of the room wide open. I asked if he could close the door while we discussed my injury. His response no because of COVID-19 a violation of my patients rights mind you Dr. Bonazt was not wearing a mask nor gloves so much for concerns. Also, while waiting on him the door was closed the entire time and anyone else that entered closed the door behind them. He ask me what my job title was twice which I’m sure was on my report. He indicated that the fracture was healing pretty good I didn’t need surgery and therefore there was nothing else he could do. I question him because I must be 100% my strength in my hand indicated that I could hold up to13lbs briefly. I asked him for copies of the report he denied me of that also, stating that workman’s comp would have to request it. Forgetting when I visit him the first time he did.  His sarcastic remarks and tone was very belittling. To add insult to injury as he was walking out he says if you break anything else come see me. Unbelievable and Rude he obviously doesn’t care because there’s no repercussions behind his actions.

text: Highly disappointed!! Went in with knee pain and swelling. I’ve had surgery twice on this knee. I was never ask to get on the exam table. Dr. Randell came in and looked at the ex ray. He didnt look at my knee much less examine it. He told me from the ex ray it didn’t  look like I had much arthritis. He then told me to take 2 Tylenol arthritis 600mg twice a day and 800 mg ibuprofen trice a day. That’s 4000mg pain meds. My stomach cannot handle all that. I told him I did not take meds unless I had to.  He never ask if I could tolerate all that. Then said he wanted to give me Cimzia shots. This shot is for rheumatoid arthritis. It also weakens your immune system and can cause heart failure. I obviously have a tear in my knee because I’ve developed a Baker cyst on the back. The baker cyst is causing a lot of pain because it’s pressing on a nerve.shame on you Dr. Randell!! I’m glad I’m not stupid enough to listen to you!

name: Godscreation02
text: This is an update of southern orthopedics surgeons. I had been seeing a Dr there since 2009 and he wasn’t fully truthful with me about how bad my situation could get. As of 2020 I have discovered I have osteoarthritis in both my knees that apparently has been progressing over the years. The new dr I’m seeing now is dr Randal. He is great and gave the situation to me like it was and how bad it could get and what I ultimately needed to do to treat this. Thank you dr Randal. I took one star off because the situation obviously did not have to get this bad. Wish I had found dr Randal in 2009.

name: karen mcmillan
text:
Wonderful staff.  Friendly, skilled, and helpful.  I am truly amazed at how much progress has been made in just 3 weeks!
The flexible hours made appts easy to fit my schedule! ❤️ Drayer!

resp.text: Karen - three cheers for you!  We are so proud of your progress and wish you the best!

name: Sandra Lynch
text:
I have used the Alabaster office after 2 knee replacement surgery and back pain. All three experiences have been excellent. They were very caring and through with my therapy.           Dr. Michael Patterson is an excellent surgeon and my aftercare at Drayer PT was exactly what I needed to recover my mobility and full range of motion. Thanks to everyone who works there.
If you are in need of PT this is definitely a great place and awesome service.

resp.text: Sandra - we are so happy to be on team "Sandra"!  Thank you so much for your kind words!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Anoynmous
text: Very pleased with my experience at this new clinic. The staff is very friendly and working hard to ensure that all patients are cared for in the best manner. Each therapist has taken their time to get to know me and see me through my appointment, no matter how few or many patients are present. The staff at the door is always so welcoming and helpful! A true joy during difficult times when trying to recover from hurting my foot.

name: Jeannie Bubbett
text: A few days after having bone spurs removed from my knee by Dr. Mark Patterson I began physical therapy at Drayer. I started the day they opened their Alabaster office. As their very first patient I have watched Drayer fill with new equipment and patients in need of their expertise. The atmosphere at Drayer has a very friendly vibe, good humor and easy conversations; everyone truly cares about their patients!  Because of their care and guidance my knee is so much better, and now I have been released with a custom home exercise program to help me improve even more! From the very first greeting I received when I arrived on day one to the last goodbyes from all of the staff, it was an awesome journey back to good health.  I highly recommend Drayer Physical Therapy Institute!

name: K. Trimmer
text: Cannot say enough good things or recommend Drayer PT more strongly. My daughter was battling a serious quad sprain for months. She was evaluated by her therapists until all the dynamics of her injury were known and then a comprehensive therapeutic plan was specifically designed for her. Hours were spent making sure she knew how to do the exercises properly, why she was doing them, and how important it was to continue to do them after she was released from therapy. I feel very confident saying that the therapists were serious about my daughter’s care and dedicated to her recovery. Five weeks after her first day of therapy, she was healed and strong enough to begin conditioning for her ball team. It has been weeks and I am still getting calls from her therapist just checking up on my daughter. Still a pleasant surprise and very much appreciated.

name: Malcolm Johnson
text: The team at this location is AWESOME. They go above and beyond. Seth is an amazing guys and does great work. Evertime I leave I feel like a new MAN.

text:
I saw Dr. Colberg for the first time (after a long and healthy discussion with BCBS) for a 3rd opinion.
His PA was amazing. She is a very good listener and sincere. She asked great pertinent questions as well. Dr. Colberg then came into exam room, introduced himself and went straight to the injury.
As it turns out, I had been misdiagnosed twice. I left in a hard cast and feel I am FINALLY on my road to recovery. Alex cast me and was outstanding. This is definitely where you need to start! I live 75 miles from ASM but will only use them going forward!!!

text: I saw Dr. Colberg because of an old ankle injury that had bothered me for years. After he explained the options, I opted for a PRP injection. After the injection, my ankle felt much better and continues to feel better one year later. I would recommend Dr. Colberg to anyone.

name: Deborah Mitchell
text: Dr. Colbert needs to learn to listen to his patients. I saw him because of my right shoulder. He injected it, it lasted 1 week. Next appointment he wanted to inject again. I refused. He gave me prednisone by mouth and said he did not need to see me again. After I finished prednisone my pain was back.  I called and demanded to see a surgeon. So Dr. Colbert ordered an MRI. It showed a torn rotator cuff and biceps tendon. No I don’t ever want to see Dr. Colbert again!

resp.text: Thank you for your candid comment. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients.

name: James Bishop
text: I’ve been dealing with a severe case of plantar fasciitis for over ten years. I had been to two different podiatrists, had shoe inserts, had multiple injections over the years. Dr. Colberg was recommended to me by another physician within the Andrews Sports Medicine family that I’ve known and trusted for years. He saw me and suggested the Topaz Microbrider procedure. They have a very high success rate and I had the procedure done. My healing was slow and my physical therapy hit a wall after about six weeks. I truly think Dr. Colberg was as disappointed as I was. He wanted to try the procedure one more time. He performed the second procedure in July. He suggested being patient with physical therapy. By November I was nearly pain free! I am now one year from the initial surgery. I have never been more impressed with a physicians intellectual and emotional investment in my case and care. It was a long and frustrating case and I wouldn’t be here without Dr Colberg and his team. I can not recommend him highly enough!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Karen Scott
text: Dr. Colberg specializes in non-invasive treatments for various issues, including the one that I have, which is arthritis in my knees.  I am very pleased with the results of PRP treatment, I now have much more mobility, strength and flexibility.

name: Greg Morton
text: I have just finished 12 weeks of therapy on my reconstructed knee, I wasn’t sure what to exspect but, it’s amazing from when I started to where I am today. I know this is your job and it’s what your paid to do but, all of you made me feel apart of my recovery, I’m not going to lie and at times it was painful as they pushed me and I thank you for you pushing me even when I didn’t want to be pushed, I enjoyed myself as we worked and had a lot of laughs along the way, I thank all of you in the Gardendale office and look forward to seeing you as I will be doing there wellness program, thank you!!!

text: Dr. Lawler has a great bedside manner.  He listens to you & explains everything. He's done surgery & injections on me & injections on my husband.  I couldn't ask for a better doctor!   My husband really likes him & that's saying something.  He hates doctors. The staff are nice too.

text: For my money Doctor Ray and his staff are some of the best in the business.  I won't go anywhere else.  He has done bot hip and knee replacements for me and a hip for my wife and was great with all three.  His physical therapy group is awesome as well. I am a retired high school coach of 28 years and multiple sports so have been around the orthopaedic business a great deal.  I would recommend him over anyone else in our area.

text: Dr. Ray has done a total knee and hip replacement for me and excellent results.  He has done joint replacement on multiple family members.  I highly recommend him.

name: A A M C O Vestavia
text: Dr. Ray performed an emergency surgery on my right hand and wrist in 2006 and did a excellent job. I drove from Birmingham to Anniston every Dr's visit to see him and my results were way better than initially expected by him and myself.  Due to the injury, it took some time to rehab but I got back to what I loved doing.  All these years later, my hand and wrist are doing great.  Thank you Dr. Ray.  I HIGHLY recommend Dr. Ray!!!

name: Margaret Wilson
text:
There may be some bogus reviews on here but maybe this last lady's review is also bogus. There is absolutely no reason anyone should have to wait in a orthopedics office for more than two hours with an appointment. I say they're in pain for 2.5 hrs after I scheduled my appointment 3 weeks before. I was in a lot of pain at that time but they claimed they couldn't get me in earlier. Customer service in this office is non existent other than collecting Co-pays.
Dr. Lawler is not as competent as done people think. He did an ankle surgery on me that was going to take me 2 weeks to be back to normal according to what he said. 3 months later I'm still in pain and it's still swollen. I truly believe that some prime are good at customer service and some need to work on a factory somewhere where talking to customers is not an requirement.

name: Lilian Wallace
text:
My daughter broke her ankle and Dr Ray did her surgery. He is excellent.
I highly recommend Dr. Ray.

name: Diane Harris
text:
IN RESPONSE TO MARGARET WILSON - IF YOU ARE REFERRING TO MY REVIEW AS BEING BOGUS, SORRY BUT YOU ARE SADLY MISTAKEN. THERE ISN'T ONE WORD THAT I POSTED THAT ISN'T TRUE! I CAN, HOWEVER, SPOT BS WHEN I SEE IT!!

I certainly hope people can differentiate between legitimate and bogus reviews.  I have been a patient of CORE Orthopedics and Sports Medicine since day one - eleven years! You will not find a better run, more efficient doctors office with more friendly employees. In the past eleven years I have never, EVER experienced or seen any of the employees be rude to ANYONE. I take some of the comments that have been made very personally, because the employees at this office are like family to me. I know their character, I know how they treat people, and I know the standard they are held to!

I cannot comment personally about Dr Lawler because I have never used his. However, I have several friends/family that have used him and every one of them have been completely happy with the level of care they received from him.

I have been Dr Ray's patient for the past eleven years. I have to be the first to admit that I am not the easiest patient to deal with,  and I  have had way more than my share of difficult issues to have to deal with over the years. Never once has there been a situation that couldn't be dealt with. Throughout my many numerous (too many to even be able to count) surgeries that I have had to go through, Dr Ray has always done a fabulous job. He deeply cares about his patients and their wellbeing.  He strives for excellence in the operating room for the best possible outcome for his patients.  He has a wonderful bedside manner and treats his patients as if they are family. His is the only practice in the area where you can schedule an appointment within a few days instead of having to wait a few weeks.

name: Mastrianni Marshall
text: The customer service is horrible. Dr. Ray IS NOT a good doctor. He will guess about your injury. I went there last wear about my knee and he gave me a shot that didn’t work & had to pay $65 for nothing. I went last week for my knee and paid $65 just for him to tell me to get a MRI done. After the MRI I thought I was going back for a follow up and the results they tried to get me to pay another $65 before I even went back there and I wasn’t going for it. WOULDN'T RECOMMEND YOU TO GO HERE.

After paying the co pay they told her she couldn't be seen because of her referral status. My parents are retired military, disabled veterans that have Tricare as their insurance. I truly believe that doctor's on the area, not just here, do not want to take on a Tricare patient because they may take up a slot that someone with better insurance can. It's a shame how the employees at this doctor's office act towards military veterans. After trying to get a referral from Tricare finally someone from the back figured out that they can get one from Tricare s web page and she was seen. I truly wish that we had more options as far as doctor's that take Tricare in this area.

text: Dr. Michael Blum and his staff are excellent at what they do!  Coming to Dr. Blum and his staff at SouthLake Orthopedics was the best thing I ever did for myself.  I had a total knee replacement a year and a half ago.  I am back to normal walking two miles a day with absolutely no pain what so ever!  I could not be happier with my experience.  Dr Blum and his staff are absolutely the best in Birmingham!!!   I thank them every single day for what they did for me.   Take my advice if you have pain, do not wait go see them. You definitely will be glad that you did. They are are all extremely helpful, nice, kind, wonderful people.

name: Teresa Parnell
text: The nurses was very professional and the shots I had to have put in my knees didn’t hurt as bad as I thought they would. They tried to make it as pain free as possible.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  We appreciate hearing from our patients!

name: Joan Ware
text: I had an emergency appointment and they took me right in. Did x-rays and saw Dr. Blum all within 30 minutes. After I saw doctor they casting crew came in and put arm in cast. I was out of office in an hour and like I said it was an emergency.

name: Jackie McFarland
text: My appointment yesterday was excellent.  Dr. Blum was extremely helpful to me.  Many questions were answered.  I have been searching for a physician like Dr. Blum for many years. His staff was so kind. The appointment began on time.

name: Sherida Harris
text: I was referred to this doctor and I have been waiting for 3 weeks for an appointment. All the paperwork that was asked for was sent but still nothing. Every time I call, I get the run around and always told that I would be called back. Not once has anyone called me. OBVIOUSLY I'm in pain if I continuously call but oh well. I'll just get my doctor to refer me to someone else. Stay away!

name: Janet Fred
text: Dr Blum is a very caring Dr. He did a knee replacement in my Mother at age 79 and treated her shoulder pain at 90. And now he is treating me for shoulder pain.

name: Roger Eatman
text: I arrived to my appointment early, got called back early and so Dr. Blum very quickly. He told me what was wrong with my knee and what needed to be done.

name: Nicole Ray
text: Everyone was so nice and kind. Everything went great.

name: Donnie Kelly
text: I have been seeing Dr Blum for over 15 years now.  I highly recommend him if you are in need of an orthopedic doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide excellent patient care.

name: Gary Grimes
text: Excellent care and office wasn't as freezing and uncomfortable as most other medical facilities

name: Patrick French
text: Dr. Bloom and his staff did a wonderful job and taking care of all my aches and pains

name: Greg Massey
text: Staff was friendly and doctor Blum was to the point and wasted no time.

name: Laura Ralph
text: Friendly, quick, and very helpful.

name: Sonia Guevara
text:
(Translated by Google) I have received very good care from Dr. Blum and those who help him, thank you very much.

He recibido una muy buena atención por parte del doctor Blum y los que le ayudan, muchas gracias.

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Thanks for the review, Sonia!

(Original)
Gracias por la reseña, Sonia!

name: Ken Howe
text: Dr. Smith has performed four surgeries on my hands over the past two years. Two carpal tunnel surgeries, one to remove gout related deposits and one To repair a finger which I seriously injured in a saw mishap. Thanks to his skills and a very capable staff I have had fantastic results. I would highly recommend him to anyone in need of hand surgery. Thank you Dr Smith and your great staff!

name: Milton Smith
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are precise and meticulous with their diagnoses. He and the staff were courteous, and  kind in their attitudes toward me. His work has allowed me to be pain free with a very troubling problem.

name: K Brown
text:
I highly recommend Dr. Smith.  He took excellent care of my mother after she fell and required surgery.  He was very patient and kind and thorough with us and answered all our questions.
I went back to him for 2 elective hand surgeries and was very pleased with his care.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! Dr. Smith is definitely the best, and we'll pass along your feedback so he knows how great of a job he did. We'll always be ready to provide you with the highest level of service whenever you or your family require orthopaedic expertise.

name: Cindy Thompson
text: Dr. Smith was a wonderful doctor. He did surgery on my thumb and did a great job. I would recommend him if you need a good surgeon. He was very nice and sweet and he set down and talked to me and let me ask questions if I needed to. Just a great doctor. I would definitely go back to him.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cindy! We're always happy to hear when we've accomplished our mission of providing 5-star care & service in our clinic.

name: Peggy Morris
text: Dr. Smith is a wonderful, caring doctor.  He diagnosed the issue with my hand, on first visit, and performed surgery. I’m pain-free and able to use it for the first time in months. The staff at Southlake Orthopedics has always been first rate and our family would go no where else for Ortho issues.

resp.text: So thrilled to hear about your experience, Peggy! And we're sure Dr. Smith and the rest of his staff will be excited to hear as well. We're lucky to have such a skilled and experienced surgeon as Dr. Smith as a part of the team.

name: Cindy Benson
text: Dr Smith did Carpal Tunnel Release surgery on my hand.  Excellent outcome.  Excellent surgeon and staff.  I highly recommend him.

name: Audrey Day
text: I am very pleased with the results of my carpal tunnel release surgery performed by doctor Smith. The whole process went smoothly from start to finish.

name: Keith Tolbert
text: I have the upmost confidence in Dr. Smith.  His background consists of prestigious schools and medical centers and he is very knowledgeable in this field. I also have great respect for Dr. Smith and and his staff.  I was very pleased with the results of my wrist after surgery and wouldn’t hesitate going back if I needed anything else.  A great man....a great doctor!!!!!!!  Thank you and God bless each one of you, Keith Tolbert

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Keith! We're so happy that you had a wonderful experience. We'll be sure to share this with Dr. Smith and the rest of the team so they know what a wonderful job they did.

name: Donna McCully
text: Great doctor as well as great staff. Wonderful surgical outcome...would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Donna! Very happy to hear about your experience, and we'll be sure Dr. Smith and the team know what a great job they did.

name: cathy martin
text: Dr. Smith performed surgery on my hand/wrist to relieve pain.  He tried other options first, which I appreciated. I would highly recommend him for your Orthopaedic needs.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cathy! We always aim to approach treatment with a surgery-last approach, but when the situation calls for it, we know we can trust the incredible expertise of Dr. Smith.

name: Tina Rinehart
text: Dr. Smith is a great doctor. He explains everything to you in a way that you understand what is going on. Him and his staff take every precaution to keep you safe as well. My mom can use her wrist/hand again now. He told her it would take 3 months after surgery and it took her 3 months just like he said. You could not ask for a better doctor and we highly recommend  him to anyone that needs an orthopedic  for their hand /wrist.  Also want to brag on their physical therapy department ladies Cathy and  Rebekah both are awesome and know their stuff.

name: Joey Lawhorn
text: A very good experience. Highly recommend Dr Smith and his entire staff.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Joey! We'll be sure to pass along your praises to the whole team. Thanks again for choosing us.

name: mickfinn4u
text:
Dr Smith ,PA and staff took great care of me and went beyond my expectations.I've been going to Southlake since 1987 and have always been well taken care of.
A+ Thanks

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Mick! Love to hear about a job well-done, but it's even better when we hear we have consistently done a great job!

name: Vicki Smith
text: There is no better surgeon than Dr. Smith.  As painful as the injury was, and the recovery physical therapy, the care was the best ever.  I've had other orthopedic surgeries in several different cities, but the professionalism of the staff is balanced with the genuine concern and care of the entire staff.  Love Dr. Smith, he's the best!

name: Otis Smith
text:
Dr. Smith reconstructed my finger after a table saw accident.  Would have never believed that the finger would have ever looked normal again, little lone functional.
His talent as a surgeon is far and above anything I have ever seen in my 60 years.
An honest, direct, extremely dedicated professional that I have highly recommend to everyone I meet in need of hand surgery.

name: Susan Hulsey
text: I stabbed my hand with a knife cutting an avocado.  Dr. Smith repaired the artery and the nerve in the palm of my hand.  I have regained strength in my hand and sensation in my fingers! I would recommend him to anyone for his knowledge, skill and expertise.  By the way, he is also nice!

name: DAVID V
text: This is the second time I used Dr. Smith for surgery - once on my wrist and once on my hand. He is an outstanding doctor from all aspects and expectations. Of all the 11 doctors that I currently using, he has the best technical skills and follow up after the surgery. Just as important, he has great people skills. He honestly cares about his patients and assures that the patient understands all options, all plans for treatment, and a clear path for recovery.  He is a very nice, caring and down to earth gentleman. I STRONGLY recommend Dr. Smith and the staff at Southlake Orthopaedics.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

name: Sheila Marcus
text: Best hand doctor I know

resp.text: Thanks for the high praise, Sheila! We appreciate you choosing our clinic, and we'll be ready to serve again should you or your family ever require orthopaedic services in the future.

name: Dianne Snow
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are absolutely fantastic in every aspect. They meet with you on a personal level making you feel comfortable and at ease. The day of my surgery was a never before experienced event; no sitting and waiting forever - I was taken back almost immediately after arriving, prepared for surgery, saw my husband, taken back and the next thing I knew I was waking up. If surgery could be an enjoyable experience, this one was. Follow up visits have been equally impressive. It’s a joy to deal with professionals of this caliber.

name: Margaret Harrill
text: I fell & broke my wrist at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic. Dr. Smith "screwed" me back together with complete success! I was very impressed with the safety precautions practiced at both the outpatient surgery center & the Grandview office. My compliments not only to Dr. Smith for his care but for his team as well, Caroline his PA & Leslie PT. All couldn't have been kinder or more encouraging. In an emergency like mine you just take your chances with the surgeon available & willing to take you on.  With Dr. Smith I won the lottery!

name: Mary Belle Van Der Noord
text: Wonderful experience from beginning to end; I had been suffering from sharp joint pain in my left wrist and thumb that interfered with daily activities as well as my sleep. I am so grateful to Dr. Smith and his team of medical professionals for giving me my hand back!!

name: Sherri Magness
text: Dr. Smith and his entire staff have been wonderful to work with from the beginning consultation to the post op meetings!  Dr. Smith and his assistant, Caroline, are both very caring and knowledgeable. I could not have asked for a better team to take care of my hand (carpal tunnel).  They answered questions before I even knew I had them!  My surgery went well and recovery has been better than anticipated!  Thank you, Dr. Smith and Staff for helping me with this and getting me back to my new normal!

name: Stanley Woodall
text: Dr. Smith did an outstanding job with my carpal tunnel surgery and has great bedside manner.

name: Zada Edwards
text:
I'm very pleased with the kindness and support from the entire staff at Southlake Orthopaedic. Dr. Smith is absolutely fabulous!  He's one of the most understanding, kind and sensitive doctors you'll ever meet! Dr Smith will take the time to explain and listen to any concerns you may have.
Everything from my surgery to my follow up appointments have been superior. If you need to see a Orthopaedic Surgeon go see this guy! He's awesome!
Zada Edwards

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback.  Patient satisfaction is so important to my team at Southlake Orthopaedics!

name: Brenda Stevenson
text: Very pleased with my care and Dr Smith’s expertise.

name: Leslie Holliday
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are professional, kind and helpful. I have used their office for two surgeries and have been more than pleased with the care I received.

name: Kimberly Rudd
text: I am very pleased with the advise, recommendations and surgical work that Dr. Michael Smith and his staff provided. I was extremely surprised and happy to see that HE personally called to check on me the night of my surgery. Usually doctors don't do that themselves. If I need Orthopaedic Hand, shoulder or finger work again, I would go back to his office!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

text: I had a piece of metal under my fingernail and had to get it surgically removed. Dr. Smith and all the staff I dealt with were absolutely amazing. Dr. Smith even calls his patients the night of the surgery to check on you and make sure everything is going ok. He’s been a blessing!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!  Our goal is to provide excellent services to our patients.

My family is very grateful to Dr. Smith!

The wait time wasn't long at all.  I'm so glad they send home with you, a what to do sheet, because you (I) can't remember whatever after my surgery.

D. Burkes

text:
The nurse who called me back and the ladies who did my x Ray and helped me up was so very nice. And when I was taken to a room and when joiner's  nurse and him came in I
Felt like I was taking up their time. Was talked to rudely and needed help for my hips and got told to get gastric surgery. And come back if I ever needed his help. Well I was there forhelp yesterday Sept 10 at 2 pm and didn't get a my.
I felt like when I asked for medicine to help my pain I was told I was taking what I needed and was rudely told narcotics I could take one and then would want more. I'm not one who takes alot of pain meds just only when I need them but joiner didn't care about me at all
Just so you know that I came over there for help and didn't get treated like a human being with feelings. I felt like I was wasting time and felt like I was there just for drugs.

Dr wasn't helpful and at one point laughed when patient told how long pain had persisted. XRAY staff told patient they are always busy and it's similar to running a factory at this location. She said they also practice at 2 or 3 other locations at the same time .  From the time we walked in the door the service was nonexistent.    Will go to Huntsville, Birmingham or Nashville next time.

This was the 1751 Veterans Dr Suite 300, Florence, AL 35630  location.

name: Janice Castleberry
text: I give Todd Miller 5 stars. My experience at North River Therapy  was very acceptable. I had to wait awhile, but it was worth the wait. Todd was very professional and efficient. He was very thorough and caring as well as very patient. He answered all my questions in a way I could understand. I would recommend Todd Miller, at North River Therapy, to anyone who is looking for a good Physical Therapist.

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Janice. It was my pleasure to work with you! I really appreciate your review.

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Steimle - that is so kind of you! Our pleasure to serve you.

text: The environment at North River Therapy is both friendly and professional. All therapists are well trained, knowledgeable, personable and caring. I highly recommend North River Therapy.

resp.text: Thank you Mrs Sandra! It has been our pleasure to work with you!

name: Rachael T
text: Before coming to North River Therapy, I was struggling to fully rehabilitate my knee after meniscus surgery. I actually came to North River Therapy due to their high patient reviews and the reviews are very accurate! The staff here is very professional and is very knowledgeable about how far to medically push the body through every step of the rehabilitation process. Before coming to North River Therapy, I could not walk up or down 6-inch stairs without having extremely sharp pain in my knee. However, thanks to North River Therapy professionals, I am now able to tackle 16-inch stairs without pain!! Thank you so much to the North River Therapy staff for all of your help and kindness!!! I also wanted to note that over the course of my physical therapy, I have seen the staff masterfully handle patients with all types of physical concerns. I have been especially impressed with how well they monitor their patients throughout the PT process, especially the elderly patients. I would recommend this establishment to everyone looking for a great physical therapist in the Northport area!!

text:
Absolutely the worst patient processing timing ever.
Took mother due to awful pain in back. 2 1/2 hour wait to see doctor Heck. We got there 15 minutes before the scheduled time to be there. I am sure if we missed it they would want to charge for missing schedule. I am totally fed up with doctors that over schedule and then want to charge you if you are late. Not sure if I would go back if doctor recommended him. “Heck” I am not sure if he will show up!

Inexcusable for that type of waiting, especially when it is a back doctor.

name: Andrea F.
text:
Dr Heck saved my life.  Went to the ER at another hospital before seeing him and they thought I was trying to get drugs since I was complaining about back pain.  Dr heck took me seriously and did surgery even though my MRI wasn’t that bad.  Found out during surgery that I had a rare condition with abnormal nerves in my back. He said he sees this condition about every 2 years. The abnormal nerves were causing the pain - I felt like I was being electrocuted.
He also later performed a back surgery on my mother. Her back is much better now.  We were worried about her surviving the surgery due to her health.  She had a rough recovery - but overall her back is much better.  Highly recommend Heck.

resp.text: Amazing story, Andrea! Thank you so much for sharing it with us, and we're thrilled to hear about you and your family's outcomes. We'll make sure your praise is known to Dr. Heck and the whole team.

text: Dr. Christopher Heck is absolutely the WORST  orthopedic surgeon in Alabama!  Due to his incompetence, a simple disc herniation has resulted in me being disabled. After two years, and I decided to let God handle him and not sue him, he got very rude with me and told me he did not want to see me anymore and less I want another surgery. After countless procedures and  thousands of dollars in physical therapy, (22 weeks all together) I will now live with his incompetent error!  He definitely lives up to his name! He’s not worth a HECK!!!!

name: Leigh Pearson
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is so amazing!  He has performed a discectomy for my sister (herniated disc with a conjoined nerve root that he found during surgery, that was causing more pain than just a herniated disc would cause).  She is doing fantastic!  He also performed a fusion from L3/L4 to L5/S1 for my mother who suffers from severe spinal stenosis.  She went from a wheelchair to a walker, and the walker is only because she has neuropathy in both feet!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful this man is!  And he’s not only a smart and talented surgeon, but he’s kind and takes the time to listen to his patients (and their caregivers)!

name: Angela Thornburg
text:
Dr. Heck is "The DOCTOR" to go see. He is personable, doesn't forget what is going on with you. He explains all procedures in detail with words and explanations that you understand.
With having 3 back surgeries before i was referred by Dr. Lawler from Oxford Alabama. My back kept becoming worse and the pain got to the point I couldnt take it anymore after hurting for about 6 years. Dr. Heck told me that he could help me but i had to have a long and extensive back surgery that was about 5 to 6 hours long. I was ready for anything and I left his office that day confident he would help me.
Dr. Heck came out 3 times during the surgery to speak to my husband to let him know how I was doing, and where he was in the surgery. That meant so much to my husband and me that he had that much consideration not to leave my husband wondering what was going on.
I came out of surgery that day PAINFREE, after 6 years of constant hurting.  I was Up walking around the hospital floor on the second day feeling like wonder woman, I went home on the 3rd day. I can also walk straight and stand straight. That was a bonus that I didn't know that could be fixed.
Everyone from the nurse care in recovery, the nurses there on the floor that took the most gentle and sweet care of me. The sweet people that brought your food, the folks that came to your room to get your food order, to the sweet sweet girls that cleaned my room were a joy to be around. GREAT HOSPITAL!!
Both of Dr Heck's office staff are great and attentive.  They Call You Right Back, friendly, and they get you right in to see him.
I can't say enough great things about Dr. Heck and his staff.  Go see him and get your hurting fixed by a Great Doctor!!! All I can say is Thank God for Dr. Heck because I can't say enough of good about him.

Even while I was in the hospital recovering from surgery, almost every nurse and PT I worked with told me how great he was and they all would only trust their children with him and that he does such a good job. He was able to perform the best possible scenario regarding my treatment and I couldn’t be more grateful, I’ll be back on the softball field sooner than later, thanks to him!

Sent me home after surgery with a prescription for pain that he failed to sign. Have not heard a word from him personally about any of this. Would probably not go back to even though his procedure seem to work very well.

Sad that it took getting to this point to be ready.  In a nutshell, Dr. Krauss and Dr. Heideprem (vascular surgeon) saved my life and I will be forever grateful to them.

name: Beth Conley
text: Dr. Timothy Haley did an outstanding job stitching our son's arm up in an emergency surgery! The billing department there is completely incompetent though. I have been disputing incorrect charges for a year now. Every other bill is paid off from his accident! They do not understand the basic concepts of re-filing a claim with a proper code. If you are a military family good luck, because they will not fix Tricare claims at all. Instead, they will send you to collections repeatedly, even when they admit it is an error on their end. Just what we need to deal with between deployments. The head of insurance and the office manager will not return your calls (or speak to you) concerning your bill. I’ve just received a second attorney’s notice of debt, after I was assured their office had handled it. Marcella needs to be removed from her position or placed in a job that she can actually handle. Insurance is over her head.

resp.text: Ms. Conley - we apologize that we did not meet your expectations. We would like to discuss this further with you to make sure that your concerns are addressed. If you would, please email pr@southernbone.com with the best phone number to reach you.

name: Jennifer Payne
text: The office personal is the worst. They have no follow through with insurance disputes, do not return phone calls, and then can't answers questions. I took my husband there. He had an xray and the first Doctor could see bone fragmants and almost all disks they could see were compressed. Took months and a very irritated phone call to get an mri. Got the mri now they say that he has no bone fragments or compressed disks. Yhe muscles are still cramping and their advice was to see a neurologist.

name: Rex Lantz
text:
Had appointment yesterday with Jennings for damaged ankle, badly swollen and discolored.  Big open area with windows and tellers like a bank when you go in.  Find the correct window then check in.  The girl there was chewing her gum like a cow eating its curd.

Wait time was 1 hour and 35 minutes .. how perfect is that.

Finally saw the doctor, Johathan Jennings a orthopedic surgeon.   Looked at x-rays for a second then my ankle.  Then he said wow .. looked at x-ray again for an additional 15 seconds and came up with  "possibly a hair line fracture but it is covered with some calcification" so not sure - CROCK.  That just doesn't occur in a short time.  He squeezed here and there and ask if it hurt which it did not.  At that point I think he was stumped.

I asked about a cortisone injection for the inflammation and swelling - nope.  OK, how about taking my NSAID's - yep sure.  I told him I have plenty of Day Pro and could try it again ... he got the deer in the headlights look and finally said he didn't know what it was - so, look it up with that fancy smart phone doc.  I told him what it was and he insisted I needed Meloxican instead.  I have high blood pressure and one of the side effects for that medication is a significant increase in BP and it has a black warning.  The other, you guessed it, swelling in the ankles and feet - ho funny is that!  Apparently he never looked over the 4 pages of paperwork they require us to fill out!  OK I say but I need a written script because I'm headed back to Florida.

I go to check out - no script - surprise, lol.  Back to the girl in the stall to ask for it.  She looks at the computer and tells me it was called in to xyz pharmacy ... 15 minutes later we got that fixed.

I was also supposed to be scheduled for a follow up in 30 days ... no one knew anything about that.  Good thing as it would be a cold day before I'd go back to see this guy or this place.  I'd have to be in real tough shape and desperate.

Definitely NOT RECOMMENDED  I shot better than a half day and $300 for this "service".  This outfit is a meat market.  They schedule 5 patients an hour and the slightest hiccup you're screwed.

text: On a Friday I made an appointment, the appointment was scheduled for a Wednesday at 7 AM. So the reception turns and ask do I want to make appointment,  I told her I did it last Friday for Wednesday at 7 o'clock for my knee. Will not be back again.

text: Appointment was for 9AM, arrived at 8:45AM. I was never called to the window. After sitting for almost an hour, I asked if I needed to complete paperwork because my appointment was for 9:00. The receptionist apologizes and gives me the paperwork.  After about another 45 minutes,  I was called to the back. The nurse apologizes for the wait and tries to explain,  takes my vitals and then....the waiting game. One doctor was relaxing in a chair conversing with another employee. I have no clue where Dr. Davis was. After wasting 3 freaking hours with these unprofessional jerks, I cancelled my appointment,  got my copay refunded and left, never to return. PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME HERE.

name: Yolanda Harriel
text: Overall wonderful

name: June Lockhart
text: Dr Micheal Davis treated me and performed surgery on me. If you are considering using him for your spine, I recommend you find another doctor. Go to UAB or SOS. I was under his care for 22 months. During the time of my care, I told him I was in excruciating pain. I was treated as if I was narcotic searching. I went to 9 doctors trying to get my MRI repeated after Dr Davis refused to repeat the test. Once the MRI was repeated and found results of severe damage to my spine on all levels, I had no choice but to return to Dr Davis because of the “Doctors are God” big boy club of Montgomery. My surgery that was supposed to only be 2 hours long was an 8 hour surgery. My bones were splintered in my lower back. I had told him prior to the surgery that because of a medical issue that he needed to treat me as if I had a bone infection. He did not. Post surgery he lied and said, “ no more MRI’s, the rods placed in your back are real metal not titanium.” *** Real metal rods were pulled from the market in the year 2000. My rods were put in in 2012. Not only that but he wrote my surgical note rather than dictation and the numbers on my rods are not legible. I also had foot drop and had a massive infection post operative. This was not a tiny infection, my temp peaked at 105.1, plus blood loss. There is much more but I have said enough, find another doctor for your own safety.

name: derrick ball
text: Personally I have had multiple visits and the wait time was always very brief (always under 15 minutes). The staff is always courteous and professional. Dr. Hussein Turki was very knowledgeable and attentive. He also took the time to explain all the parameters and patiently listened to and answered any questions I had. I would highly recommend this staff to anyone and everyone.

name: Jeff Naile
text:
Six months out of surgery, four months of physical therapy and I still cannot raise my arm higher than shoulder level without severe pain. Post OP MRI shows, and I quote, " There appears to be a full thickness defect along the anterior supraspinatus at the level of the critical zone/footplate."
Hartzog decides NOT to do any repair and releases me with an impairment rating of 4%.
Yes, you read that right, 4%.
They are more concerned with their relationship with workers comp insurance carriers than the well being of their patients.
I have an appointment with another orthopedic surgeon for a second opinion.
Very disappointed with the level of professionalism at Alabama Orthopedic Specialists.

name: Barb
text:
Dr. Davis staff is rude to patients. Waste of time waiting for hours for no help to resolve back issues. They could at least post a wait time or let people know something. Doctor's should stand by their appointment. I understand when they have an emergency which most nurses will let the customers know so they can choose to wait or reschedule. I will be finding another doctor. I have a job and my time is valuable.

Dr. Thornbury & Barringer have been great to work with & a good staff. Excellent compared to Dr. Davis.

name: Brook Martin
text: My fiancé's appointment was at 10:30AM with Dr. Davis. We signed in at 10:17AM. We were finally called in at 12:00PM. Jessie, the Nurse Practitioner came in at 12:08PM and left soon after. We finally saw Dr. Davis at 12:49PM. He came in and gave us his medical advice which was very unhelpful. I then asked if he would recommend another back doctor for a second opinion, and he refused to recommend anyone other than himself. As we were leaving, he proceeded to record his notes of our visit very loudly. The entire lobby could hear my fiancé's name, birth date, and all of the details of our visit. I will be reporting him for violating HIPAA Privacy laws, and we of course have cancelled all future appointments.

Why make my appointment at 2 if the doctor isn't available?! So unprofessional! Almost two hours of waiting in a frigid room to not get seen?! Don't waste your time here. I was supposed to see Dr. Bennett by the way. Supposed to anyways, because I never saw him. Two hours of my life I'll never get back.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text:
I refer to Dr. Craig as a medical detective. I had seen several physicians that could not figure out what was wrong with me. He discovered that I have a very rare neurological disorder. Without his knowledge and expertise, I could have suffered years with this with no help from the medical community.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. That did not work for me. He could have done a series of them. But he did not. He knew that wasn’t what was best for me. He is not trying to line his wallet. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. My case is proof, he is going to find what is wrong and do what is best for his patients.

name: Daisy Blue05
text: Should not have gone through so much pain after a knee revision surgery by Dr. F. After the surgery I did physical therapy and still in pain. Returned to Dr F who just assumed  I had a back problem without him even taking a X-ray. For 7 months he sent me to get injections in my spine. I was still in pain and referred to a back surgeon and what he found was a deteriorated right hip. Once again Dr. F sent me to get injections in my hip. I got an injection in my hip but I will get second opinions with another surgeon on all that Dr. F’s unprofessionally surgery he did and putting me through what he did and assuming I had back problems without an X-ray. I’m sure Dr. F wouldn’t appreciate his family going through what he put me through which could have all been avoided if he would have taken one X-ray. He needs to learn that he can’t see through a person to diagnose their problems. I won’t return here ever again or be put through pain for 7 months for his neglect of a surgeon who only wanted his money. After 7 months he did not know who I was which showed me that he is a money hungry surgeon only. Young surgeon who needs to get his facts straight and stop assuming what’s wrong. A surgeon who didn’t know who I was?  He finally did an X-ray but took 7 months for him to do it. I’ve had enough and never again. Take my advice and find you another surgeon besides Farris you will regret it if you do. I have 3 witnesses to back me up , another surgeon and a injection specialist who also asked me where my back X-ray was, there wasn’t one.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not meet your expectations during your time in our clinic. To discuss your experience further, please email pr@southernbone.com. Thank you.

name: Richard Taylor
text: Not military friendly at all.  My daughter had an appointment here while we were in a PCS status, and because of this and technical difficulties with Tricare, the insurance claim wasn't paid immediately.  We were able to resolve the paperwork once we got to our new duty station, but SBAJS had already passed it to a collections agency and refused to recall it.

resp.text: Mr. Taylor - we apologize that you had trouble in regards to the insurance/billing process. If you are still needing assistance, please feel free to email pr@southernbone.com and someone from our office will contact you.

name: Eternal Underscore
text: No one answers during business hours and on call service can't take messages regarding appointments.

resp.text: I'm sorry that we have been unable to connect with you. If you would please email pr@southernbone.com with your name and best contact number, someone from our office will call you. Thank you!

text:
I saw Dr Lett with a bad hip pain I was had been having for several months. It was determined after X Ray's I needed a Left Hip replacement. It was scheduled to be done November 18th. I was released the next day and I have to say I had wished I done it a long time ago 3 days later I'm walking without a walker. Dr. Lett and his entire staff were amazing.
Daniel Jowers

name: Eryka Kenschaft
text: I have extensive injuries from a car accident and was recieving treatment in PA. I went to get a follow up examination because I’m temporarily here in Enterprise Alabama getting help from my mom until I am fully healed. Dr Lett came in the exam room  for 4-5 min and didn’t ask me anything about how I was actually doing but wrote an evaluation stating false information that he never even asked me. He offered no physical therapy and insisted since I am young I will be fine. I want to get better and need professional medical help yet he failed to provide this. I honestly don’t know what to do..

resp.text: Ms. Kenschaft - we apologize that your expectations were not met during your office visit. If you wish to discuss your feedback further, please email pr@southernbone.com and provide a phone number that you may be reached.

The only thing is I forgot to ask doctor Farris for a picture of the x-ray of my son's broken elbow. He wanted a picture, did not want the cast.

name: Jena Hughes
text:
I actually injured myself on 6/15 and I could not be seen during office hours. I went to an urgent care and had X-rays and was told to follow up with Orthopedic Dr to go from here. Which would be no different had I went to the ER in Enterprise.
I touched base on Friday when I woke up and the telephone receptionist was so very rude. It was suggested to give it the weekend and call back on Monday.
I called Monday 6/19 and was still swelling, hurting and very upset because I knew driving was also going to come into play. I stuck only with ibuprofen instead of pain medication. As soon as I woke up I called around 8:45AM.  Of course, I explained the story again, passed on my insurance information, and updated my personal information. The young lady on the phone was rude and very short. She then told me that she would speak to the Dr and get back with me. I got dressed and was ready to go as soon as she told me. My Mom was here to make sure I had help etc.  I also called the Irgent care place and requested a disc of my X-rays to pick up. My phone rang again around 11:30 and am was asked if I could contact the urgent care place and have the radiology report sent to SB&J. I did and she said that once the Dr had that info she would call me back and try to get me in after talking to the Dr. Again, we sat and waited for hours. At around 3:20 I received a phone call informing me that the Dr wanted me to wait until Wednesday and continue what I was doing. I stressed again the pain, how unstable I was feeling and the problems with being on crutches. She placed me on hold and came back again and rudely said "call back on Wednesday".
So, I wasted mine and my Mother's Day trying to get appropriate help. It was now 3:40 in the afternoon.
I woke up this morning 6/21 and called first thing this morning, around 8:30AM only to reach a different and terrible personality on the phone. I explained the entire situation again.  She said that she would talk to the Dr and give me a call back. Of course, my Mother was here once again to help me. At around 11:40AM I received a call and an appointment was schedule for 6/22. I explained the pain, how long I had been put off and again was not her problem and you could tell she didn't care. I said, "there is no way I can be seen today?"  Her response, "The Dr is trying to leave early today and there is nothing else I can do!"  I explained that I would be calling around to get into a different branch or somewhere else. She didn't care about me and neither did that Dr apparently. I was angry and emotionally upset. I felt like this practice had no reason to be in business.
I contacted a different office and guess what. It was 11:50AM and I had an appointment at 1:50PM. The Dr I saw was awesome and nobody seemed to be surprised by my story. Also, all the information that I had given to the rude ladies was not passed along. I had to go by and pick up a disc and a copy of the report to take with me. I now have the appropriate diagnosis, I am not in pain, the correct stability, an exercise strategy and feel 💯% better. I did not want to cancel the appointment that was scheduled with the other office out of anger but I also did not want to be charged for a no show. I called back and a different rude lady answered the phone and I asked to speak to the girl i spoke with earlier. (Yes, I have the Dr's name and two of the girls I spoke with names however, I will keep them off the review. I told her I needed to cancel the appointment and she said, "fine and hung up". So if you want to be treated like you are human or that you are actually cared about this Customer Service and Orthopedic office is NOT the place you want to be.
In all honesty they are the only ones here in Enterprise and they must think we need them however, truth be told they need us. Without patients there is no practice. I would love nothing more than to see this business disappear and fail.
Horrible way to treat people especially when I did everything I was asked to do. 😡

text: Wow! A PT office that I actually look forward to coming to 3 times a week. I am a huge fan!! I am walking again after major surgery with a big thanks to these two truly incredible therapists ❤️

name: Chrissy McCandless
text: I can't say enough about this place. The staff are wonderful and extremely caring and knowledgeable. The facility is very clean and open, it does not feel as though you are "packed in" and overly crowded like most places. I have been to a few other therapy centers over the fast few years, and they are by far the best. I chose this location because I heard about a treatment called, dry needling. I have 2 herniated discs in my cervical spine and I have tried everything to relieve the pain from massage therapy to multiple steroid injections, a nerve ablation and even CBD oil with no relief. I am currently scheduled for my 2nd cervical fusion surgery in a few days, and prior to dry needling and this round of physical therapy, the pain in my neck and shoulder was at an 8 out of ten on the pain scale. I chose dry needling because as anyone with cervical spine issues knows, the knots in your upper back and shoulders are ridiculously painful. Today is my last day of physical therapy, in just 9 sessions of therapy and 4 dry needling sessions with Haley, my pain level went from an 8 to a 2, which is amazing. I would highly recommend Dreyer Physical Therapy to anyone seeking relief from pain. They are miracle workers.

resp.text: Thank you Chrissy!
